quotes.quote: An Assassin, a real Assassin had to look like one-black clothes, hood, boots, and all. If they could wear any clothes, any disguise, then what could anyone do but spend all day in a small room with a loaded crossbow pointed at the door?
The greatest assassin of life is haste, the desire to reach things before the right time which means overreaching them.
My dad was a quiet assassin. He was really charming and smiley and softly spoken, but he could knock you out in a second.
Words without actions are the assassins of idealism.
Assassins did have a certain code, after all. It was dishonorable to kill someone if you weren't being paid.
Assassin?… That sounds so exotic… I was just a murderer.
I thought the Secret Service would protect me from the press, but they were at my house to protect me from assassins with guns, not with assassins with pencils.
Idea-assassins rush forward to kill any new suggestion on the grounds of its impracticality, while defending whatever now exists as practical, no matter how absurd.
How shall the murdered man convince his assassin he will not haunt him.
A wet boy has a deader, an assassin has a target, because assassins sometimes miss.
I was no assassin. I got out during the amnesty because I had not committed any violent crimes.
One kills a man, one is an assassin; one kills millions, one is a conqueror; one kills everybody, one is a God.
War is the statesman's game, the priest's delight, the lawyer's jest, the hired assassin's trade.
The important thing to know about an assassination or an attempted assassination is not who fired the shot, but who paid for the bullet.
Being an assassin means knowing when to kill - and when not to kill.
Fear is an assassin; if you let it in your life, it will kill your dreams.
Assassins take no pride in fighting fairly. We take pride in winning.
Assassins: they got sass and live on sin.
It would be either a very skilled or very unwise man to steal from an assassin. - Taliesin
The weapon of the advocate is the sword of the soldier, not the dagger of the assassin.
A man feared that he might find an assassin; Another that he might find a victim. One was more wise than the other.
We work in the darkness to serve the light. We are Assassins.
I need a break. There's no retirement home for assassins, is there? Archery at four. Riflery at five.
Yeah, an Assassin hired an Assassin and then followed the Assassin to supervise the Assassination and then Assassinated the Assassin when the Assassination went wrong.
You're not an assassin of fate, Sloan. You're just a thug who can bend bullets.
What do you call it when the assassins accuse the assassin? A lie. A lie and we have to be merciful.
I'm a warrior, an assassin. I don't dance.
Think of it as a hobby. Something you do to relax. You're an 'assassination enthusiast.'
All women are assassins of one stripe or another. Most of them just kill your dreams.
Dating an assassin and didn't even notice. Just another man underestimating a woman's capacity for evil.

Assassination has always been a legitimate tool of statecraft. Its respectability and public acceptance has varied from civilization to civilization, but its practical application has remained remarkably consistent.
When a man leads assassins, he is also an assassin.
It only becomes assassination when people put their dignity and their past in a balance and removes one.
That's a vulgar generalization. But yes, you take an ordinary man an turn him into an assassin. That was our goal.
Meaning I don't think the world doesn't need another League of Assassins. It could use a league of heroes. It wouldn't be a one-woman job.
Assassinations... little wars around the world.
You know, most assassinations are one and done. Hit men acquire a target, execute them, and then disappear.
Assassins who stay too long wind up getting assassinated, and that ain't in my game plan.
The assassin always dies, baby. It's necessary for the national healing.
But, of course, even assassins should have a holiday now and then.
It's nearly impossible to defend against an assassin who's willing to die for his cause.
The higher you climb, the more you realize that you're surrounded by sycophants and assassins.

Assassination is one percent shooting, ninety-nine percent preparation: anticipating moves, devising approaches, recruiting sources, finding the perfect opportunity so the bullet's almost an after-thought.
I said he was an assassin. There is a difference, you know. A hit man kills people, anyone, for a price. An assassin murders important figures, politicians, monarchs.

It is how it works. Let's say there's a massacre somewhere. There's an assassination, but the assassin never gets caught. I make people forget about them. Has there been a huge fraud? Call for me and I'll make them forget.
But an assassin that can go where he pleases is not to be taken lightly.
I'm a holistic assassin... I kill whoever I like killing all day and if I killed them, they were my target.
You want to assassinate someone, vision is a basic requirement. It's like: step one: pick a person to kill. Step two: kill that person.
Assassins are meant to be quiet. Precise. We do not go announcing conspiracies from the rooftops to all who pass by.
We're Assassins and we follow a creed, aye. But it does not command us to act or submit - only to be wise.
It's easy enough to assassinate a powerful man. The real trick, the art of it, is finding someone else to put the blame on.
The assassins job was to kill.
That is why the assassin's job is so interesting: No job is the same as the last one.
Most of the assassins specialized in a special form of assassination and they all were quiet and smooth and clean.
No matter what the assassin intended--to act out his fantasy, kill for profit, or spark a revolution--the death of a political figure has some political impact.
Assassination is simply a violent crime with political implications.
Yet even in the fierce and brutal politics of the Italian Renaissance, the moral assassin was not absent.
The assassin is an assassin even when his victim escapes.
The assassins have many faces, but they are of the same spirit.
